messages.message: Hello! Russia sounds like he is opening Moscow into St Pete. Just thought I'd let you know to help you plan.
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'Hello! Russia sounds like he is opening Moscow into St Pete. Just thought I'd let you know to help you plan.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Germany's message provides you with information about Russia's potential moves, showing an intent to help you plan strategically and indicating a cooperative attitude.

messages.message: Hello there! You seem to be certain about that. I wont be making my plans on something like that, you will understand that, I could easily get locked in a deadly war that way.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'Hello there! You seem to be certain about that. I wont be making my plans on something like that, you will understand that, I could easily get locked in a deadly war that way.'.

messages.message: I'll be honest and say I'm not enthused about seeing Austria get attacked from Italy and Russia, although I am pleasantly surprised seeing Russia open more southerly. I'm not sure what your plans are, but we would both hate to see a wintergreen alliance, which looks very possible right now.
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'I'll be honest and say I'm not enthused about seeing Austria get attacked from Italy and Russia, although I am pleasantly surprised seeing Russia open more southerly. I'm not sure what your plans are, but we would both hate to see a wintergreen alliance, which looks very possible right now.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Germany's message indicates a shared perspective on the board situation and expresses concerns about a potential alliance forming against both of you, suggesting a genuine effort to establish common ground and work together.

messages.message: I am not sure what is happening, but you did send wrong info on Russia. Your agenda looks like making me fight Russia. I could if you are willing to commit.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'I am not sure what is happening, but you did send wrong info on Russia. Your agenda looks like making me fight Russia. I could if you are willing to commit.'.

messages.message: Russia promised me he would help support me into North Sea from Norway, implying he would move north. That obviously didn't happen.
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'Russia promised me he would help support me into North Sea from Norway, implying he would move north. That obviously didn't happen.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Germany's message reveals a broken promise by Russia to support them into the North Sea from Norway, indicating a potential shift in alliances or untrustworthiness on Russia's part, aligning with your concerns regarding Russia's intentions.

messages.message: That also implies you don't help England or that you help him to het in Norway in the first place. We definitely should stay in contact and work our way to brighter future.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'That also implies you don't help England or that you help him to het in Norway in the first place. We definitely should stay in contact and work our way to brighter future.'.

messages.message: tought times for you and me
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'tought times for you and me'.

messages.message: would you be interested in cooperation with me and maybe italy
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'would you be interested in cooperation with me and maybe italy'.

messages.message: Yes, but how?
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'Yes, but how?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Germany's response indicates an interest in cooperation but seeks clarification on the specifics and practicalities of how the cooperation with you and potentially Italy would work, showing an open-minded approach and willingness to discuss potential alliances.

messages.message: Let england and france fight each other, maybe even side with france to secure land border. I'll try to talk to italy, could you do it also? Austria is a mere vassal so maybe a word, but not too much. Italian army could be very useful if he decides to work with us. After a round or two explain england that russia is behind everything and that you could help him if he turns on russia
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'Let england and france fight each other, maybe even side with france to secure land border. I'll try to talk to italy, could you do it also? Austria is a mere vassal so maybe a word, but not too much. Italian army could be very useful if he decides to work with us. After a round or two explain england that russia is behind everything and that you could help him if he turns on russia'.

messages.message: Rough idea, but neither I or you have better option. If we do have please say so
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'Rough idea, but neither I or you have better option. If we do have please say so'.

messages.message: So did Turkey stab you?
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'So did Turkey stab you?'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. Germany's message directly asking if Turkey stabbed you may indicate a lack of trust or suspicions towards you, possibly trying to instigate doubt or discord in your relationship with Turkey.

messages.message: I am Turkey... LoL
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'I am Turkey... LoL'.

messages.message: Lol

messages.output: You should trust the message. Germany's simple and light-hearted response with "Lol" indicates a friendly and non-confrontational interaction, suggesting a casual and amicable tone in the conversation.

messages.message: I meant to ask is Russia stabbed you
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'I meant to ask is Russia stabbed you'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Germany's clarification about intending to ask if Russia stabbed you shows a genuine interest in understanding your relationship with Russia and suggests an open and direct communication style aimed at getting the right information.

messages.message: If

messages.output: You should not trust the message. Germany's response with only "If" lacks clarity and context, making it difficult to interpret the intended meaning or message being conveyed, possibly indicating unfinished thoughts or unclear communication.

messages.message: I would say so now
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'I would say so now'.

messages.message: Do you think you can persuade england to help?
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'Do you think you can persuade england to help?'.

messages.message: I've been trying to persuade him all game and have done nothing to him but he still attacks me even when France and Russia are gonna clobber him.
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'I've been trying to persuade him all game and have done nothing to him but he still attacks me even when France and Russia are gonna clobber him.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Germany's message provides insight into their efforts to persuade England and the challenging dynamics of the situation, indicating a willingness to work with others and cooperate strategically, which aligns with a cooperative attitude and potential for collaboration.

messages.message: England says you are refusing a truce with him
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'England says you are refusing a truce with him'.

messages.message: That's false. I asked England for help and he said the only way he would help me is if I stopped France from attacking him. I said I'd try but that that would be very difficult. I reached out to England and he is asking for unreasonable things in return. I have no control over France
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'That's false. I asked England for help and he said the only way he would help me is if I stopped France from attacking him. I said I'd try but that that would be very difficult. I reached out to England and he is asking for unreasonable things in return. I have no control over France'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Germany's explanation counters the claim made by England, providing details of their interactions and shedding light on the unrealistic demands put forth by England, indicating a transparent and reasonable approach to negotiations and possibly hinting at England's manipulative behavior.
